byline.original: By BARRY MEIER and REBECCA R. RUIZ

lead_paragraph: Efforts to tighten oversight of charities have largely failed because of regulatory indifference, political lobbying or lack of political will.

headline.print_headline: Patchwork Oversight Allows Dubious Charities to Operate
headline.main: Patchwork Oversight Allows Dubious Charities to Operate

snippet: Efforts to tighten oversight of charities have largely failed because of regulatory indifference, political lobbying or lack of political will.
abstract: Problems with regulation of charities have been revealed by charges brought against James T Reynolds Sr for operating fraudulent charities that fleeced donors of more than $187 million; oversight of charities is largely responsibility of Internal Revenue Service, and strengthening regulation has run into obstacles like lobbying and insufficient political will to change system.
